intro: Olea mildbraedii, commonly known as the Mildbraed's olive, is a rare and endemic species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Oleaceae family, which includes other olive trees and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. It is typically found in rocky, well-drained soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Olea mildbraedii is considered a vulnerable species.
